module.name: Align Linear
module.description:
This is a general linear intramodality registration tool (within or across subjects, 2D or 3D). The user can specify any of a variety of models, including rigid-body, affine, or perspective.
The program will generate a .air file that can be used to reslice the specified reslice data set to match the specified standard data set.
64-bit compilation

input.name: Standard Volume
input.description: The atlas that the input file is resliced to match.

input.name: Reslice Volume
input.description: The input being registered to the standard-file.

output.name: Linear Transformation
output.description: Resultant linear spatial transformation matrix saved as a .air file

input.name: Model Number
input.description: Defines the degrees of freedom of the transformation. 3-D models: 6. rigid body 6 parameter model 7. global rescale 7 parameter model 9. traditional 9 parameter model (std must be on AC-PC line) 12. affine 12 parameter model 15. perspective 15 parameter model 2-D models (constrained to in-plane, no interpolation): 23. 2-D rigid body 3 parameter model 24. 2-D global rescale 4 parameter model 25. 2-D affine/fixed determinant 5 parameter model 26. 2-D affine 6 parameter model 28. 2-D perspective 8 parameter model AIR 5.0

input.name: Threshold Standard
input.description: The threshold for the Standard Volume defines a minimum voxel value. Voxels in the Standard Volume with intensities below this value are excluded from analysis when computing the cost function and its derivatives. The value should always be an integer less than the maximum voxel value in the corresponding file.

input.name: Threshold Reslice
input.description: The threshold for the Reslice Volume defines a minimum voxel value. Voxels in the Reslice Volume with intensities below this value are excluded from analysis when computing the cost function and its derivatives. The value should always be an integer less than the maximum voxel value in the corresponding file.

input.name: Blur Standard
input.description: The Gaussian smoothing filter for the Standard Volume. Smoothing filters are applied along the x, y, and z axes of the Standard Volume before performing registration. The FWHM value specifies the full width at half maximum of the Gaussian smoothing filter to be applied along each dimension. The filters have units of millimeters (or whatever units you use to specify voxel sizes in your .hdr files). All three dimensions must be specified. If you give a value of zero, no smoothing will be applied along the corresponding dimension.

input.name: Blur Reslice
input.description: The Gaussian smoothing filter for the Reslice Volume. Smoothing filters are applied along the x, y, and z axes of the Reslice Volume before performing registration. The FWHM value specifies the full width at half maximum of the Gaussian smoothing filter to be applied along each dimension. The filters have units of millimeters (or whatever units you use to specify voxel sizes in your .hdr files). All three dimensions must be specified. If you give a value of zero, no smoothing will be applied along the corresponding dimension.

input.name: Segment Standard
input.description:
Number of partitions for the standard image. This defines the number of partitions used for segmenting the standard file in the forward direction WHEN USING THE STANDARD DEVIATION OF THE RATIO IMAGE AS THE COST FUNCITON. If this value is zero, no forward direction computation is performed. A value of 256 is typically used for intermodality registration when the corresponding file is an MRI study. For MRI-PET registration, the number of partitions corresponding to the PET study should be set to zero. When registering two dissimilar MR images, both data sets can be assigned 256 partitions. For intramodality registration, the default value of 1 is appropriate.
AIR 5.0 Note that AIR now uses dynamic partitioning by default. Instead of dividing the theoretical range of voxel intensities into the designated number of partitions, the actual range of voxel intensities is divided into this number of partitions. This assures that when the dynamic range of the data is restricted, the voxels do not all end up occupying far fewer partitions than requested. The "Static Partitioning" option forces the use of static partitioning as in AIR 3.0x.

input.name: Segment Reslice
input.description:
Number of partitions for the Reslice Volume. This defines the number of partitions used for segmenting the Reslice Volume in the reverse direction WHEN USING THE STANDARD DEVIATION OF THE RATIO IMAGE AS THE COST FUNCITON. If this value is zero, no reverse direction computation is performed. A value of 256 is typically used for intermodality registration when the corresponding file is an MRI study. For MRI-PET registration, the number of partitions corresponding to the PET study should be set to zero. When registering two dissimilar MR images, both data sets can be assigned 256 partitions. For intramodality registration, the default value of 1 is appropriate.
AIR 5.0 Note that AIR now uses dynamic partitioning by default. Instead of dividing the theoretical range of voxel intensities into the designated number of partitions, the actual range of voxel intensities is divided into this number of partitions. This assures that when the dynamic range of the data is restricted, the voxels do not all end up occupying far fewer partitions than requested. The "Static Partitioning" option forces the use of static partitioning as in AIR 3.0x.

input.name: Standard Mask Volume
input.description: This volume is applied to the Standard Volume as a mask. The file must match the corresponding file's dimensions, and voxels that are zero in this file will be treated as if they were zero in the corresponding file when computing the cost function. Mask files can be binary or regular files.

input.name: Reslice Mask Volume
input.description: This volume is applied to the Reslice Volume as a mask. The file must match the corresponding file's dimensions, and voxels that are zero in this file will be treated as if they were zero in the corresponding file when computing the cost function. Mask files can be binary or regular files.

input.name: Spatial Initialization
input.description: An ASCII file containing spatial transformation initialization parameters. These parameters can be used to control the starting position for automated registration, a feature that is useful if the initial misregistration is extreme (e.g., > 45 degrees of rotational misregistration) or if the default registration leads to an obviously incorrect result. Different spatial models require different numbers and types of parameters in the initialization file. Note that some cost functions may also allow an intensity parameter initialization file as well.

output.name: Spatial Termination
output.description: An ASCII file to be created containing spatial transformation termination parameters. These parameters can then be used as initialization parameters to restart the algorithm at the same location in parameter space where it left off (using the same spatial model). This allows you to switch cost functions or to vary smoothing, among other things. Different spatial models create incompatible files. Note that some cost functions may also allow an intensity parameter termination file.

input.name: Scaling Initialization
input.description: An ASCII file containing a single parameter that initializes intensity scaling.

output.name: Scaling Termination
output.description: An ASCII file containing the intensity scaling parameter identified as optimal by the algorithm. Combined with a spatial transformation initialization file, this parameter can be used to restart the algorithm at the same location in parameter space where it left off. In addition, the scaling parameter can be used as an intensity normalization factor for subsequent statistical analysis of the registered data or as input to reslice to create a final image that is intensity corrected as well as spatially corrrected.

input.name: Samplings
input.description: Determines the number of intermediate iterative cycles of the algorithm. The current sampling is divided by this ratio with each cycle to determine the new sampling.

input.name: Convergence Threshold
input.description: Controls how small the predicted change in the cost function must be in order to meet the convergence criteria. Setting this value too large will result in convergence while the images are still misregistered; setting it too small may lead to a failure to converge.

input.name: Repeated Iterations
input.description: The maximum number of iterations permitted at each sampling density. If this number is made too low, it will lead to inaccurate results and/or slow down the overall performance of the algorithm by preventing you from making use of information that could have been derived more quickly at the prematurely aborted, more superficial sampling.

input.name: Halt After Steps Without Improvement
input.description: The maximum number of iterations without any observed improvement in the cost function. If greater than or equal to repeated-iterations, this value has no effect. At lower values, it can help you escape from situations where you are bouncing back and forth between two or three locations in parameter space without making any real progress. This sort of thing usually only happens at superficial sampling densities.

input.name: Use Non-positive Definite Hessian Matrices
input.description: A currently unvalidated method for overcoming non-positive definite Hessian matrices.

input.name: Static Partitioning (AIR 3.0 compatible)
input.description: Forces the use of static partitioning, reverting to the default behavior of AIR 3.0x.

input.name: Non-interaction of Spatial Parameter Derivatives
input.description: Assumes a non-interaction of spatial parameter derivatives (reduces likelihood of non-positive definite Hessian matrices).

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Extremely detailed reporting of interim results.

input.name: Pre-alignment Interpolation
input.description: Provides pre-alignment interpolation to cubic voxels.

input.name: Cost Function
input.description:
The cost function to be used for alignemtn as selected from the following menu: 1. Standard deviation of ratio images cost function: This cost function has the advantage of being independent of image intensity, so image intensities can be poorly matched and the registration will not be adversely affected. This is the only model that allows multiple partitions as required for intermodality registration.
2. Least squares cost function: This cost function assumes that the image intensities are scaled identically. Least squares is computationally simpler and therefore faster than the standard deviation of ratio images, but may be inaccurate if the image intensities are poorly matched.
3. Least squares with global rescaling cost function This cost function is identical to the least squares cost function except that an intensity scaling term is added to the model.

module.name: BET
module.description: BET (Brain Extraction Tool) deletes non-brain tissue from an image of the whole head. It can also estimate the external skull surface.

input.name: Input File
input.description: Specifies the input file.

input.name: Outline Brainsurface
input.description: Generates brain surface outline overlaid onto original image.

input.name: Don't Segment Output
input.description: Don't generate segmented brain image output.

input.name: Fractional Intensity Threshold
input.description: Specifies fractional intensity threshold (0->1); default=0.5; smaller values give larger brain outline estimates

input.name: Vertical Gradient Threshold
input.description: Specifies vertical gradient in fractional intensity threshold (-1->1). (Default=0) Note: Positive values give larger brain outline at bottom, smaller at top.

input.name: Head Radius
input.description: Specifies head radius (mm not voxels) Note: Initial surface sphere is set to half of this.

input.name: Center of Gravity
input.description: Specifies center-of-gravity (mm not voxels) of initial mesh surface.

input.name: Apply Thresholding
input.description: Apply thresholding to segmented brain image and mask.

input.name: Brain Surface as Mesh
input.description: Generates brain surface as mesh in OFF format.

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Enables verbose text output.

module.name: MRI Convert
module.description: mri_convert is a general purpose utility for converting between different file formats. mri_convert will try to figure out the file format on its own from the format of the file name (eg, files that end in .img are assumed to be in spm analyze format).

input.name: Input Volume
input.description: The name of the input volume.

filetype.name: GDF file
filetype.description: GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use gis)

filetype.name: NIFTI1 file
filetype.description: NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files)

filetype.name: SPM file
filetype.description: SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d)

input.name: Drop Frames
input.description: Drop the last <n> frames.

input.name: TE
input.description: TE in msec. Must specify <te>.

input.name: Output Info
input.description: Displays information about the output volume.

input.name: Crop
input.description: <x> <y> <z> Crop to 256 around center (x,y,z).

input.name: Output j Size
input.description: Specifies the output <j size>.

input.name: Zero GE z Offset
input.description: Sets c_s=0 (appropriate for DICOM files from GE machines with isocenter scanning).

input.name: Output Orientation Setting
input.description:
Supply the orientation information in the form of an orientation string (ostring). The ostring is three letters that roughly describe how the volume is oriented. This is usually described by the direction cosine information as originally derived from the dicom but might not be available in all data sets. You'll have to determine the correct ostring for your data.
The first character of ostring determines the direction of increasing column. The second character of ostring determines the direction of increasing row. The third character of ostring determines the direction of increasing slice.
e.g. If the volume is axial starting inferior and going superior the slice is oriented such that nose is pointing up and the right side of the subject is on the left side of the image, then this would correspond to LPS, i.e. as the column increases, you move to the patients left; as the row increases, you move posteriorly, and as the slice increases, you move superiorly. Valid letters are L, R, P, A, I, and S. There are 48 valid combinations (eg, RAS, LPI, SRI). Some invalid ones are DPS (D is not a valid letter), RRS (can't specify R twice), RAP (A and P refer to the same axis). Invalid combinations are detected immediately, an error printed, and the program exits. Case-insensitive.
Note: you can use tkregister2 to help determine the correct orientation string.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 1)
input.description: Specifies option <sonata | allegra | GE> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 2-5 as well.

input.name: Output i Direction
input.description: Specifies the output i direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Output k Count
input.description: Specifies the output <k count>.

input.name: Resample Type
input.description: Specifies resample type. Must specify <interpolate|weighted|nearest|sinc|cubic>. (Default=interpolate)

input.name: TI
input.description: TI in msec (note uppercase flag). Must specify <ti>.

input.name: Force RAS Good
input.description: Uses default when orientation is absent.

input.name: Input Orientation Settings
input.description:
Supply the orientation information in the form of an orientation string (<ostring>). The <ostring> is three letters that roughly describe how the volume is oriented. This is usually described by the direction cosine information as originally derived from the dicom but might not be available in all data sets. You'll have to determine the correct ostring for your data.
The first character of ostring determines the direction of increasing column. The second character of ostring determines the direction of increasing row. The third character of ostring determines the direction of increasing slice.
e.g. If the volume is axial starting inferior and going superior the slice is oriented such that nose is pointing up and the right side of the subject is on the left side of the image, then this would correspond to LPS, i.e. as the column increases, you move to the patients left; as the row increases, you move posteriorly, and as the slice increases, you move superiorly. Valid letters are L, R, P, A, I, and S. There are 48 valid combinations (eg, RAS, LPI, SRI). Some invalid ones are DPS (D is not a valid letter), RRS (can't specify R twice), RAP (A and P refer to the same axis). Invalid combinations are detected immediately, an error printed, and the program exits. Case-insensitive.
Note: you can use tkregister2 to help determine the correct orientation string.

input.name: Input Info
input.description: To display information about input volume.

input.name: Apply Inverse Transform
input.description: This option applies the specified transformation file (xfm) inversely.

input.name: Output j Direction
input.description: Specifies the output j direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input Stats
input.description: Displays statistical information about the input volume.

input.name: Input i Direction
input.description: Specifies the input i direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Flip Angle
input.description: Flip Angle in radians. Must specify <flip_angle>.

input.name: Output j Count
input.description: Specifies the output <j count>.

input.name: Output k Size
input.description: Specifies the output <k size>.

input.name: Skip Frames
input.description: Skip the first <n> frames.

input.name: No Scale Flag
input.description: Doesn't allow changing type of input to that of template. Must specify <n>. 1 = Don't rescale values for COR.

input.name: Output Data Type
input.description: Specifies the output data type. Must specify <uchar|short|int|float>.

input.name: Input i Size
input.description: Specifies the input <i size>.

input.name: Output Stats
input.description: Displays statistical information about the output volume.

input.name: Input k Size
input.description: Specifies the input <k size>.

input.name: Output k Direction
input.description: Specifies the output k direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input j Direction
input.description: Specifies the input j direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: FWHM
input.description:
<fwhm>
Smooth input volume by <fwhm> mm.

input.name: Crop Size
input.description: <dx> <dy> <dz> Crop to size <dx, dy, dz>.

input.name: Output Center
input.description: Specifies the output center coordinates. Must specify <R coordinate>, <A coordinate> and <S coordinate>.

input.name: Input j Size
input.description: Specifies the input <j size>.

input.name: Output Matrix
input.description: Displays output matrix.

input.name: Input Center
input.description: Specifies the input center coordinates. Must specify <R coordinate>, <A coordinate> and <S coordinate>.

output.name: Output Volume
output.description: The name of the output volume.

input.name: Input k Direction
input.description: Specifies the input k direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input Matrix
input.description: Displays input matrix.

input.name: Output i Count
input.description: Specifies the output <i count>.

input.name: Apply Transform
input.description: This option applies the transformation (xfm) file to the input volume.

input.name: Output i Size
input.description: Specifies the output <i size>.

input.name: Like Volume
input.description: Output is embedded in a volume like specified volume.

input.name: TR
input.description: TR in msec. Must specify <tr>.

input.name: Input Scale Factor
input.description:
<factor>
Input intensity scale factor.

input.name: Conform Size
input.description:
<size_in_mm>
Conform to the src min direction size.

input.name: Input Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:
cor - MGH-NMR COR format (deprecated) mgh - MGH-NMR format mgz - MGH-NMR gzipped (compressed) mgh format minc - MNI's Medical Imaging NetCDF format (output may not work) analyze - 3D analyze (same as spm) analyze4d - 4D analyze spm - SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d) ge - GE Genesis format (input only) gelx - GE LX (input only) lx - same as gelx ximg - GE XIMG variant (input only) siemens - Siemens IMA (input only) dicom - generic DICOM Format (input only) siemens_dicom - Siemens DICOM Format (input only) afni - AFNI format brik - same as afni bshort - MGH-NMR bshort format bfloat - MGH-NMR bfloat format sdt - Varian (?) outline - MGH-NMR Outline format otl - same as outline gdf - GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use -gis) nifti1 - NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files) nii - NIfTI-1 volume (single file) Note: if the input/output has extension .nii.gz, then compressed is used.
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Template Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:
cor - MGH-NMR COR format (deprecated) mgh - MGH-NMR format mgz - MGH-NMR gzipped (compressed) mgh format minc - MNI's Medical Imaging NetCDF format (output may not work) analyze - 3D analyze (same as spm) analyze4d - 4D analyze spm - SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d) ge - GE Genesis format (input only) gelx - GE LX (input only) lx - same as gelx ximg - GE XIMG variant (input only) siemens - Siemens IMA (input only) dicom - generic DICOM Format (input only) siemens_dicom - Siemens DICOM Format (input only) afni - AFNI format brik - same as afni bshort - MGH-NMR bshort format bfloat - MGH-NMR bfloat format sdt - Varian (?) outline - MGH-NMR Outline format otl - same as outline gdf - GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use -gis) nifti1 - NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files) nii - NIfTI-1 volume (single file) Note: if the input/output has extension .nii.gz, then compressed is used.
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Template Info
input.description: Dump info about template.

input.name: Status File (DICOM Convert)
input.description: Outputs status file for DICOM conversion.

input.name: Parse Only
input.description: Parse only.

input.name: Reorder Axes
input.description:
<olddim1> <olddim2> <olddim3>
Reorders axes such that: olddim1 is the new column dimension olddim2 is the new row dimension olddim3 is the new slice dimension.
Example: 2 1 3 will swap rows and cols.

input.name: List (DICOM Conversion)
input.description: Lists DICOM files for conversion.

input.name: GDF Image File
input.description: <gdf image file stem>

input.name: Invert Contrast
input.description:
<threshold>
All voxels in volume greater than specified threshold are replaced with 255-value. Only makes sense for 8 bit images. Only operates on the first frame.

input.name: Conform
input.description: Conform to 1mm voxel size in coronal slice direction with 256^3 or more.

input.name: No Write
input.description: Does not write to specified output.

input.name: Output Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:
cor - MGH-NMR COR format (deprecated) mgh - MGH-NMR format mgz - MGH-NMR gzipped (compressed) mgh format minc - MNI's Medical Imaging NetCDF format (output may not work) analyze - 3D analyze (same as spm) analyze4d - 4D analyze spm - SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d) ge - GE Genesis format (input only) gelx - GE LX (input only) lx - same as gelx ximg - GE XIMG variant (input only) siemens - Siemens IMA (input only) dicom - generic DICOM Format (input only) siemens_dicom - Siemens DICOM Format (input only) afni - AFNI format brik - same as afni bshort - MGH-NMR bshort format bfloat - MGH-NMR bfloat format sdt - Varian (?) outline - MGH-NMR Outline format otl - same as outline gdf - GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use -gis) nifti1 - NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files) nii - NIfTI-1 volume (single file) Note: if the input/output has extension .nii.gz, then compressed is used.
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Input n SPM Zero Pad
input.description:
<N>
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Input Volume?
input.description: Specifies input volume.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 2)
input.description: Specify option <fullUnwarp | through-plane> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1, 3-5 as well.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 3)
input.description: Specifies option <JacobianCorrection | noJacobianCorrection> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1-2, 4-5 as well.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 4)
input.description: Specifies option <linear | sinc> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1-3 and 5 as well.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 5)
input.description: Specifies <sincInterpHW> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 1-4 as well.

module.name: MRI Convert
module.description: mri_convert is a general purpose utility for converting between different file formats. mri_convert will try to figure out the file format on its own from the format of the file name (eg, files that end in .img are assumed to be in spm analyze format).

input.name: Input Volume
input.description: The name of the input volume.

filetype.name: GDF file
filetype.description: GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use gis)

filetype.name: NIFTI1 file
filetype.description: NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files)

filetype.name: SPM file
filetype.description: SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d)

input.name: Drop Frames
input.description: Drop the last <n> frames.

input.name: TE
input.description: TE in msec. Must specify <te>.

input.name: Output Info
input.description: Displays information about the output volume.

input.name: Crop
input.description: <x> <y> <z> Crop to 256 around center (x,y,z).

input.name: Output j Size
input.description: Specifies the output <j size>.

input.name: Zero GE z Offset
input.description: Sets c_s=0 (appropriate for DICOM files from GE machines with isocenter scanning).

input.name: Output Orientation Setting
input.description:
Supply the orientation information in the form of an orientation string (ostring). The ostring is three letters that roughly describe how the volume is oriented. This is usually described by the direction cosine information as originally derived from the dicom but might not be available in all data sets. You'll have to determine the correct ostring for your data.
The first character of ostring determines the direction of increasing column. The second character of ostring determines the direction of increasing row. The third character of ostring determines the direction of increasing slice.
e.g. If the volume is axial starting inferior and going superior the slice is oriented such that nose is pointing up and the right side of the subject is on the left side of the image, then this would correspond to LPS, i.e. as the column increases, you move to the patients left; as the row increases, you move posteriorly, and as the slice increases, you move superiorly. Valid letters are L, R, P, A, I, and S. There are 48 valid combinations (eg, RAS, LPI, SRI). Some invalid ones are DPS (D is not a valid letter), RRS (can't specify R twice), RAP (A and P refer to the same axis). Invalid combinations are detected immediately, an error printed, and the program exits. Case-insensitive.
Note: you can use tkregister2 to help determine the correct orientation string.

input.name: Unwarp Gradient Nonlinearity (Option 1)
input.description: Specifies option <sonata | allegra | GE> for unwarp gradient nonlinearity. Note: Must choose options 2-5 as well.

input.name: Output i Direction
input.description: Specifies the output i direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Output k Count
input.description: Specifies the output <k count>.

input.name: Resample Type
input.description: Specifies resample type. Must specify <interpolate|weighted|nearest|sinc|cubic>. (Default=interpolate)

input.name: TI
input.description: TI in msec (note uppercase flag). Must specify <ti>.

input.name: Force RAS Good
input.description: Uses default when orientation is absent.

input.name: Input Orientation Settings
input.description:
Supply the orientation information in the form of an orientation string (<ostring>). The <ostring> is three letters that roughly describe how the volume is oriented. This is usually described by the direction cosine information as originally derived from the dicom but might not be available in all data sets. You'll have to determine the correct ostring for your data.
The first character of ostring determines the direction of increasing column. The second character of ostring determines the direction of increasing row. The third character of ostring determines the direction of increasing slice.
e.g. If the volume is axial starting inferior and going superior the slice is oriented such that nose is pointing up and the right side of the subject is on the left side of the image, then this would correspond to LPS, i.e. as the column increases, you move to the patients left; as the row increases, you move posteriorly, and as the slice increases, you move superiorly. Valid letters are L, R, P, A, I, and S. There are 48 valid combinations (eg, RAS, LPI, SRI). Some invalid ones are DPS (D is not a valid letter), RRS (can't specify R twice), RAP (A and P refer to the same axis). Invalid combinations are detected immediately, an error printed, and the program exits. Case-insensitive.
Note: you can use tkregister2 to help determine the correct orientation string.

input.name: Input Info
input.description: To display information about input volume.

input.name: Apply Inverse Transform
input.description: This option applies the specified transformation file (xfm) inversely.

input.name: Output j Direction
input.description: Specifies the output j direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input Stats
input.description: Displays statistical information about the input volume.

input.name: Input i Direction
input.description: Specifies the input i direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Flip Angle
input.description: Flip Angle in radians. Must specify <flip_angle>.

input.name: Output j Count
input.description: Specifies the output <j count>.

input.name: Output k Size
input.description: Specifies the output <k size>.

input.name: Skip Frames
input.description: Skip the first <n> frames.

input.name: No Scale Flag
input.description: Doesn't allow changing type of input to that of template. Must specify <n>. 1 = Don't rescale values for COR.

input.name: Output Data Type
input.description: Specifies the output data type. Must specify <uchar|short|int|float>.

input.name: Input i Size
input.description: Specifies the input <i size>.

input.name: Output Stats
input.description: Displays statistical information about the output volume.

input.name: Input k Size
input.description: Specifies the input <k size>.

input.name: Output k Direction
input.description: Specifies the output k direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input j Direction
input.description: Specifies the input j direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: FWHM
input.description:
<fwhm>
Smooth input volume by <fwhm> mm.

input.name: Crop Size
input.description: <dx> <dy> <dz> Crop to size <dx, dy, dz>.

input.name: Output Center
input.description: Specifies the output center coordinates. Must specify <R coordinate>, <A coordinate> and <S coordinate>.

input.name: Input j Size
input.description: Specifies the input <j size>.

input.name: Output Matrix
input.description: Displays output matrix.

input.name: Input Center
input.description: Specifies the input center coordinates. Must specify <R coordinate>, <A coordinate> and <S coordinate>.

output.name: Output Volume
output.description: The name of the output volume.

input.name: Input k Direction
input.description: Specifies the input k direction. Must specify <R direction>, <A direction> and <S direction>.

input.name: Input Matrix
input.description: Displays input matrix.

input.name: Output i Count
input.description: Specifies the output <i count>.

input.name: Apply Transform
input.description: This option applies the transformation (xfm) file to the input volume.

input.name: Output i Size
input.description: Specifies the output <i size>.

input.name: Like Volume
input.description: Output is embedded in a volume like specified volume.

input.name: TR
input.description: TR in msec. Must specify <tr>.

input.name: Input Scale Factor
input.description:
<factor>
Input intensity scale factor.

input.name: Conform Size
input.description:
<size_in_mm>
Conform to the src min direction size.

input.name: Input Type
input.description:
<type>
Legal values for --in_type (-it) and --out_type (-ot) are:
cor - MGH-NMR COR format (deprecated) mgh - MGH-NMR format mgz - MGH-NMR gzipped (compressed) mgh format minc - MNI's Medical Imaging NetCDF format (output may not work) analyze - 3D analyze (same as spm) analyze4d - 4D analyze spm - SPM Analyze format (same as analyze and analyze3d) ge - GE Genesis format (input only) gelx - GE LX (input only) lx - same as gelx ximg - GE XIMG variant (input only) siemens - Siemens IMA (input only) dicom - generic DICOM Format (input only) siemens_dicom - Siemens DICOM Format (input only) afni - AFNI format brik - same as afni bshort - MGH-NMR bshort format bfloat - MGH-NMR bfloat format sdt - Varian (?) outline - MGH-NMR Outline format otl - same as outline gdf - GDF volume (requires image stem for output; use -gis) nifti1 - NIfTI-1 volume (separate image and header files) nii - NIfTI-1 volume (single file) Note: if the input/output has extension .nii.gz, then compressed is used.
CONVERTING TO SPM-ANALYZE FORMAT
Converting to SPM-Analyze format can be done in two ways, depending upon whether a single frame or multiple frames are desired. For a single frame, simply specify the output file name with a .img extension, and mri_convert will save the first frame into the file. For multiple frames, specify the base as the output file name and add --out_type spm. This will save each frame as baseXXX.img where XXX is the three-digit, zero-padded frame number. Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

Frame numbers begin at one. By default, the width the of zero padding is 3. This can be controlled with --in_nspmzeropad N where N is the new width.

input.name: Template Info

input.name: Status File (DICOM Convert)

input.name: Parse Only
input.description: Parse only.

input.name: Reorder Axes
input.description:
<olddim1> <olddim2> <olddim3>
Reorders axes such that: olddim1 is the new column dimension olddim2 is the new row dimension olddim3 is the new slice dimension.

module.name: MRI Watershed
module.description: Strips skull and other outer non-brain tissue. Usage: mri_watershed [<options>] invol outvol

input.name: Expand
input.description: Expand the surface.

input.name: Atlas
input.description: Use the atlas information to correct the segmentation. NOTE: When the segmented brain is not correct, this option might help you.

input.name: Help
input.description: Displays the usage message.

input.name: Manual Parameters
input.description: Change the different parameters csf_max, transition_intensity and GM_intensity. Requires: <int_csf> <int_trn> <int_gray>

input.name: Surface Debug
input.description: Visualize the surfaces onto the output volume.

input.name: Change Threshold
input.description: Change the threshold in the watershed analyze process. Requires: <int_threshold>

input.name: Mask Volume
input.description: Mask a volume with the brain mask.

input.name: Preflooding Height
input.description: Precise the preflooding height (in percent). Requires: <int_hpf>

input.name: Specify Radius
input.description: Specify the radius of the brain (in voxel unit). Requires: <int_r>

input.name: Use Surface SRAS
input.description: (c_(ras) = 0) Uses the surface RAS coordinates (not the scanner RAS) x for surface vertex position. The default is to use the scanner RAS coordinate c_(ras) != 0.

input.name: Specify Center
input.description: Specify the center of the brain (in voxel unit).

input.name: Closest Dark Point
input.description: Go to the closest darkest point during <int_niter> iterations. (Default: 10) Requires: <int_niter>

input.name: Add Seed Point
input.description: Add a seed point. Range: 0-255.

input.name: Keep Edits
input.description: Keep edits as indicated by the differences. Note: This does not change output, just create <NewWithEditsVol>. Requires: <PreEditVol> <PostEditVol> <NewWithEditsVol>

input.name: No T1 Analysis
input.description: Specify no T1 analysis. This is useful when running out of memory.

output.name: Output Volume
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Shrink
input.description: Shrink the surface.

input.name: Version
input.description: Displays the current version.

input.name: Labelize Output
input.description: Labelize the output volume into scalp, skull, csf, gray and white.

input.name: T1 Volume
input.description: Specify the T1 input volume file path.

input.name: No Watershed Analyze
input.description: Specifies the program not to use the watershed analyze process.

input.name: First Temp
input.description: Use only the first template smoothing + local matching.

input.name: Input Volume
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

input.name: Save Shrunk Brain Surface
input.description: To save the brain surface shrank inward of <int_h> mm. Requires: <int_h>

input.name: Save Brain Surface
input.description: Save the brain surface. Requires: <surfname>

input.name: Watershed + Temp
input.description: Watershed algorithm and first template smoothing.

input.name: Brain Atlas
input.description: Specifies which gca file to use as atlas

module.name: Reslice
module.description:
An AIR linear transformation is applied to a Volume to bring it from the compatible source space to the target space specified within the transform.
64-bit compilation 16-bit output

input.name: Input (.air Linear Transformation)
input.description: Defines the source space and the target space for the source volume to transformed into. The source space and the source volume must possess compatible dimensions and should be of the same space.

output.name: Output (Resliced Volume)
output.description: A new volume created by the application of the given transform to the given volume in the target space provided by the transform.

input.name: Alternate Reslice File
input.description: A volume compatible with the source space in the transform file that is to be converted to the target space provided by the transform.

input.name: Divide by Intensity Scale Factor
input.description: Change the output intensities of the produced volume by dividing by this scale factor.

input.name: Divide by Intensity Scale Factor File
input.description: scales output by dividing by factor specified in file

input.name: Retain Standard Volume's Voxel Dimensions
input.description: Do not allow cubic interpolation of voxels in the target space, but instead retain the voxel dimensions of the standard file that defines the target space.

input.name: Interpolation Model 2-6
input.description: The type of interpolation to be used to create the new volume: 0: Nearest neighbor (should be used for enumerated value files where only specific values have meanings and should be available). 1: Trilinear 2: Windowed sinc in the original XY plane, linear along Z. (requires the X- and Y-half-window-widths be provided). 3: Windowed sinc in the original XZ plane, linear along Y. (requires the X- and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 4: Windowed sinc in the original YZ plane, linear along X. (requires the Y- and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 5: 3D windowed sinc. (requires the X-, Y-, and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 6: 3D windowed scanline sinc. (requires the X-, Y-, and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 7: 3D unwindowed scanline sinc. 10: 3D scanline chirp-z. 11: scanline chirp-z in the original XY plane, linear along the Z-axis. 12: scanline chirp-z in the original XZ plane, linear along the Y-axis. 13: scanline chirp-z in the original YZ plane, linear along the X-axis.

input.name: Overwrite
input.description: grants permission to overwrite output

input.name: Multiply by Intensity Scale Factor
input.description: Change the output intensities of the produced volume by mutiplying by this scale factor.

input.name: Multiplicative Intensity Scale Factor
input.description: scales output using multiplicative factor specified in file

input.name: Alternate X-dimension/size/shift
input.description: Alters output x-dimension, x-voxel size or causes shift of output along the x-axis. Provide alternate X-dimension parameters to create voxels along said dimension. Requires the number of voxels and the size of the voxel along X. A shift of the volume in this dimension is optional. (<voxels> <size> [shift]).

input.name: Alternate Y-dimension/size/shift
input.description: Alters output y-dimension, y-voxel size or causes shift of output along the y-axis. Provide alternate Y-dimension parameters to create voxels along said dimension. Requires the number of voxels and the size of the voxel along Y. A shift of the volume in this dimension is optional. (<voxels> <size> [shift]).

input.name: Alternate Z-dimension/size/shift
input.description: Alters output z-dimension, z-voxel size or causes shift of output along the z-axis. Provide alternate Z-dimension parameters to create voxels along said dimension. Requires the number of voxels and the size of the voxel along Z. A shift of the volume in this dimension is optional. (<voxels> <size> [shift]).

input.name: Interpolation Model 0, 1, 7, 10-13
input.description: The type of interpolation to be used to create the new volume: 0: Nearest neighbor (should be used for enumerated value files where only specific values have meanings and should be available). 1: Trilinear 2: Windowed sinc in the original XY plane, linear along Z. (requires the X- and Y-half-window-widths be provided). 3: Windowed sinc in the original XZ plane, linear along Y. (requires the X- and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 4: Windowed sinc in the original YZ plane, linear along X. (requires the Y- and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 5: 3D windowed sinc. (requires the X-, Y-, and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 6: 3D windowed scanline sinc. (requires the X-, Y-, and Z-half-window-widths be provided). 7: 3D unwindowed scanline sinc. 10: 3D scanline chirp-z. 11: scanline chirp-z in the original XY plane, linear along the Z-axis. 12: scanline chirp-z in the original XZ plane, linear along the Y-axis. 13: scanline chirp-z in the original YZ plane, linear along the X-axis.

module.name: Brain Surface Extractor
module.description: Brain Surface Extractor: Removes non-brain tissue from the MRI using a combinations of anisotropic diffusion filtering, MArr-Hildreth edge detection, and mathematical morphology

citations.citation: Shattuck DW, Sandor-Leahy SR, Schaper KA, Rottenberg DA, and Leahy RM, (2001) "Magnetic Resonance Image Tissue Classification Using a Partial Volume Model", Neuroimage 13(5):856-876 PMID: 11304082

input.name: Input File
input.description: Whole Brain Volume

input.name: Edge Sigma
input.description: edge detection constant [default: 0.62]. Typical range is [0.5,1.0].

input.name: Diffusion Constant
input.description: Typical range is [5.0,40.0] for byte images

input.name: Iterations
input.description: Number of iterations for diffusion filter.

input.name: Verbosity
input.description: 0=silent, 1=limited, 2=all warnings.

input.name: Trim Brainstem
input.description: Trim brainstem

input.name: Size
input.description: radius of erosion/dilation filter [default: 1]

input.name: Dilate Final Mask
input.description: Dilate final mask

input.name: Show Timing
input.description: Show Timing

input.name: Remove Neck
input.description: remove neck (assumes LPI orientation)

input.name: Retain Orientation
input.description: Retain original orientation (default behavior will auto-rotate input NII files to LPI orientation)

module.name: VotingDecision
module.description:
This module consists of a list of voting methods that can be used to reconcile the opinion given by a cluster of skull stripping algorithms.
The opinion from the SS cluster has been aggregated into a binary-hisotgram like file by "BrainMaskAggregator" module. The output of this module could be a brain mask in analyze format (if -i is not used or a non-ss image is not provided) or a skull-stripped analyze image. If a non-ss analyze image volumn is provided, the module will merge the brain mask which is generated by applying the histogram input with the selected voting method to produce the appropriate output file.
The purpose of this module is to explore different voting methods to combine the outputs from a cluster of skull-stripping algorithms in the form of binary histogram on voxel basis.

input.name: plurality voting
input.description: The flag is used to turn on plurality voting. When the number of ones is greater than the number of zeros for a voxel, the output is 1 for that voxel.

input.name: threshold voting
input.description:
The flag is used to turn on threshold based voting. When the total of ones for a voxel is greater than the threshold specified in the input argument, the output for that voxel is 1. Otherwise, it is 0. If the threshold is set to 50, it is equivalent to plurality voting.
argument input should be ranged from 0 <= threshold <= 100.

input.name: non skull stripped image volumn
input.description: It is used to specify a non skull stripped image volumn (analyze file).

input.name: brain mask histogram binary
input.description: It specifies the brain mask histogram binary file. The brain mask histogram is generated by aggregating the outputs from the SS cluster.

output.name: output
output.description: It specifies the output image volumn file if -i is used. Or it specified the output mask volumn file in analyze format.

input.name: aggressive voting
input.description: This flag is used to turn on "aggressive voting" method. Aggressive voting is a very conservative way to do skull stripping. In each voxel, if any of the outputs from the SS cluster is 0, it will output 0 for that voxel. That means, the only condition in which this method will output 1 for a voxel is that we get one from every SS algorithm unanimously.

input.name: aggressive threshold voting
input.description:
This flag is used to turn on "aggressive threshold voting". The threshold specifies the minimum number of zeros received from the SS cluster in order to set the voxel as zero (i.e. stripped it out). It is equivalent to aggressive voting above if the threshold is set to 0.
Valid range of input is 0 <= zthreshold < 100

module.name: MINC Math
module.description: Minc Math allows for most common mathematical operations on minc volumes(such as addition, multiplication, thresholding, etc.).

input.name: Byte
input.description: Write out byte data.

input.name: Short
input.description: Write out short integer data.

input.name: Long
input.description: Output longs for MincMath

input.name: Double
input.description: Write out double-precision floating-point data.

input.name: Float
input.description: Write out single-precision floating-point data.

input.name: Signed
input.description: Write signed integer data.

input.name: Unsigned
input.description: Write unsigned integer data. This option is default if type specified.

input.name: Range
input.description: Specifies the valid range for output data. (Default: 0 0)

input.name: Ignore Invalid Data
input.description: Ignore invalid data (NaN) for accumulations.

input.name: Illegal Value
input.description: Value to write out when an illegal operation is done. (Default: 1.79769e+308)

input.name: Constant
input.description: Synonym for -constant. (Default: 1.79769e+308)

input.name: Constant2
input.description: Specify two constant arguments (Default: 1.79769e+308 1.79769e+308)

input.name: Add Volumes
input.description: Add N volumes

input.name: Subtract by Constant
input.description: Subtract volume - constant.

input.name: Multiply by Constant
input.description: Multiply volume * constant.

input.name: Divide by Constant
input.description: Divide volumes by constant.

input.name: Invert Volume
input.description: Calculate 1/x at each voxel.

input.name: Square Root
input.description: Take square root of a volume.

input.name: Square
input.description: Take square of a volume.

input.name: Absolute Value
input.description: Take absolute value of a volume.

input.name: Maximum
input.description: Find the maximum of N volumes.

input.name: Minimum
input.description: Find the minimum of N volumes.

input.name: Exponential
input.description: Calculate c2*exp(c1*x). The constants c1 and c2 default to 1.

input.name: Logarithm
input.description: Calculate log(x/c2)/c1. The constants c1 and c2 default to 1.

input.name: Scale
input.description: Scale a volume: volume * c1 + c2.

input.name: Clamp
input.description: Clamp a volume to lie between two values.

input.name: Segment
input.description: Segment a volume: within range = 1, outside range = 0.

input.name: Nsegment
input.description: Opposite of -segment: within range = 0, outside range = 1.

input.name: Percent Difference
input.description: Percent difference between 2 volumes, thresholded (const def=0.0).

input.name: Equality of Volumes
input.description: Test for integer vol1 == vol2.

input.name: Not Equal (Volumes)
input.description: Test for integer vol1 != vol2

input.name: Greater Than (volumes)
input.description: Test for vol1 > vol2.

input.name: Greater Than or Equal (volumes)
input.description: Test for vol1 >= vol2.

input.name: Less Than (volumes)
input.description: Test for vol1 < vol2.

input.name: Less Than or Equal (volumes)
input.description: Test for vol1 <= vol2.

input.name: And
input.description: Calculate vol1 && vol2 (&& ...).

input.name: Or
input.description: Calculate vol1 || vol2 (|| ...).

input.name: Not
input.description: Calculate !vol1.

input.name: isNaN
input.description: Test for NaN values in vol1.

input.name: nisNaN
input.description: Negation of -isnan.

input.name: Count Valid
input.description: Count the number of valid values in N volumes.

input.name: Overwrite (clobber)
input.description: Overwrite existing file.

input.name: Do Not Overwrite (noclobber)
input.description: Don't overwrite existing file (default).

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Print out log messages. This is the default seting.

input.name: Quiet
input.description: Do not print out log messages.

input.name: Debug
input.description: Print out debugging messages.

input.name: Copy Header
input.description: Copy all of the header from the first file.

input.name: Nocopy Header
input.description: Do not copy all of the header from the first file.

input.name: File-type
input.description: Use data type of first file. This is the default setting.

input.name: Max Buffer Size
input.description: Specify the maximum size of the internal buffers (in kbytes). (Default: 4096)

input.name: Dimension
input.description:
Specify a dimension along which we wish to perform a calculation.
NOTE: This option can be used only when performing calculations with volumes NOT when it is a mathematical operation using a volume and a constant.

input.name: Check Dimensions
input.description: Check that files have matching dimensions. This is the default setting.

input.name: No-check Dimensions
input.description: Do not check that files have matching dimensions.

input.name: Propagate NaN
input.description: Invalid data in any file at a voxel produces a NaN. This is the default setting.

input.name: NaN
input.description: Output NaN when an illegal operation is done. This is the default settting.

input.name: Zero
input.description: Output zero when an illegal operation is done.

input.name: Integer
input.description: Write out 32-bit integer data.

input.name: Input Mincs
input.description: Specify the input MNC file(s).

input.name: Less Than (vol & int)
input.description: Test for vol1 < const.

input.name: Less Than or Equal (vol & int)
input.description: Test for vol1 <= constant.

input.name: Equality of Volume and Constant
input.description: Test for vol1 == const.

input.name: Divide Volumes
input.description: Divide 2 volumes.

input.name: Greater Than (vol & int)
input.description: Test for vol1 > constant.

input.name: Subtract Volumes
input.description: Subtract 2 volumes.

input.name: Invert by Constant
input.description: Calculate constant/x at each voxel.

input.name: Greater Than or Equal (vol & int)
input.description: Test for vol1 >= const.

input.name: Add by Constant
input.description: Add volume + constant.

input.name: Multiply Volumes
input.description: Multiply N volumes.

input.name: Not Equal (Vol & Int)
input.description: Test for vol1 != const.

module.name: metcomp
module.description: metcomp: IRMA's metric computation tool -- compares image alignments using a specified set of metrics. metcomp [options] reference_image reg_image_0 [reg_image_1 reg_image_2...]

input.name: Output format type
input.description:
Defines which output format to use. Options are:
0. condensed onto one line 1. lumped with a common header 2. one record per metric per image pair
equivalently: --format

input.name: Set of metrics to compute
input.description:
A sequence of metric names (or numbers) with commas and/or hyphens (indicating sequences); this specifies which set of metric values is computed for pairs of images:
1. msd mean square difference 2. adi absolute itensity difference 3. edi entropy of difference image 4. mif mutual information 5. nmi normalized mutual information 6. ncc Pearson product-moment cross correlation 7. cor correlation ratio 8. woo wood's coefficient 9. red redundancy 10. uni a universal metric 11. aum another universal metric

input.name: Window size
input.description:
query window size in pixels (default: full image)
equivalently: --window num

input.name: Normalized values?
input.description:
compute normalized values (default: off)
equivalently: --norm

input.name: Help?
input.description:
display help message explaining command-line options
equivalently: --help

input.name: Verbose?
input.description:
turn on verbosity (off)
equivalently: --verbose

input.name: Quiet?
input.description:
turn off verbosity (default: on)
equivalently: --quiet

input.name: Save temporary results?
input.description:
save intermediate/temporary files (default: off)
equivalently: --savetmp

input.name: Size of overlapping regions
input.description:
size of overlapping region in pixels (default: 0)
equivalently: --overlap

input.name: Version?
input.description:
outputs version information and halts
equivalently: --version

output.name: Optional output file
output.description:
prefix of output stream (default: stdout)
equivalently: --output path

input.name: Reference image
input.description: reference image (aka template image)

input.name: Registration image(s)
input.description: ... image(s) for which metric values are to be computed, measuring distance from the reference image.

module.name: FLIRT
module.description: FLIRT (FMRIB's Linear Image Registration Tool) is a fully automated robust and accurate tool for linear (affine) intra- and inter-modal brain image registration.

citations.citation:
S.M. Smith, M. Jenkinson, M.W. Woolrich, C.F. Beckmann, T.E.J. Behrens, H. Johansen-Berg, P.R. Bannister, M. De Luca, I. Drobnjak, D.E. Flitney, R. Niazy, J. Saunders, J. Vickers, Y. Zhang, N. De Stefano, J.M. Brady, and P.M. Matthews. Advances in functional and structural MR image analysis and implementation as FSL. NeuroImage, 23(S1):208-219, 2004
PMID: 15501092

input.name: Input
input.description: Specifies the input volume file path.

input.name: Reference
input.description: Specifies the input reference image.

output.name: Output
output.description: Specifies the output volume file path.

input.name: Initial Matrix File
input.description: Specifies the Input 4x4 affine matrix - autodetects format ascii/medx. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

output.name: Output Matrix File
output.description: Outputs the matrix in 4x4 ascii format. Must specify <matrix-filename>.

input.name: Datatype
input.description: Forces the output to one of the following data types: char, short, int, float, double.

input.name: Cost
input.description: Specifies the intensity based cost function. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Search Cost
input.description: Specifies the type of search cost. Options are: mutualinfo, corratio, normcorr, normmi, leastsq. (Default is corratio)

input.name: Angle Rep
input.description: Specifies the type of angle rep. Options are: {quaternion,euler} (default is euler)

input.name: Interpolation
input.description: Specifies the type of final interpolation. Options are: trilinear, nearestneighbour, sinc. (Default is trilinear)

input.name: Sinc Width
input.description: Specifies the full sinc width in voxels. (Default is 7)

input.name: Bins
input.description: Specifies the number of histogram bins. (Default is 256)

input.name: Transform Degrees of Freedom
input.description:
Specifies the number of degrees of freedom. (Default is 12)
Note: Choose from 6,7,9 or 12 Degrees of Freedom (DOF) for full 3D registrations. Also includes a 3DOF 2D-to-2D registration mode which is selected using the -2D option. Note that it does not perform any search in 2D mode, and cannot deal with 2D to 3D registrations. More flexible DOF options are provided by the specific schedule files provided in $FSLDIR/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: No Sampling
input.description: Do not change input sampling.

input.name: Force Scaling
input.description: Forces rescaling even for low-res images.

input.name: Min Sampling
input.description: Sets minimum voxel dimension for sampling (in mm).

input.name: Apply XFM
input.description: Applies transform (no optimization). (Requires -init option)

input.name: Apply XFM with Isotropic Resample
input.description: As applyxfm but forces isotropic resampling. Must specify <scale>.

input.name: Padding Size
input.description: Interpolates outside image by size (in voxels). (Requires -applyxfm option)

input.name: Search X
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for x-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Y
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for y-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: Search Z
input.description: Specifies <min_angle> & <max_angle> for z-dimension angular search range (in degrees). (Default is -90 90)

input.name: No Search
input.description: Sets all angular search ranges to 0 0. (Sets 0 0 for -searchrx, -searchry and -searchrz)

input.name: Coarse Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 60)

input.name: Fine Search
input.description: Specifies angular search range by specifying <delta_angle> (in degrees). (Default is 18)

input.name: Schedule
input.description:
Schedule file specifies what transformations/DOF are allowed and how the optimisation is performed. Must specify <schedule-file>. (Replaces default schedule)
Note: Several other schedule files could be used - including 3D translation only schedules, etc. These are all stored in ${FSLDIR}/etc/flirtsch.

input.name: Reference Weight
input.description: Use weights for reference volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: Input Weight
input.description: Use weights for input volume. Must specify input <volume> for weights.

input.name: 2D
input.description: Use 2D rigid body mode. (Ignores -dof option)

input.name: Verbose
input.description: Specifies level of verboseness. (0 is least and default)

input.name: Pause
input.description: Enables pause at each stage of transformation.

input.name: Sinc Window
input.description: Specifies the type of sinc window. Options are: rectangular, hanning, blackman.

input.name: Version
input.description: Prints the version information and exit

input.name: Help
input.description: Prints help information and exit.
